Prerequisites: SATISFACTORY COMPLETION OF ENC0020, REA0002, AND MAT0024, OR APPROPRIATE PLACEMENT SCORES.
Course Description: INTRODUCTION TO FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS AND PROCEDURES. GENERALLY ACCCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES AND THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE ARE EMPHASIZED. TOPICS INCLUDE MERCHANDISING ACTIVITIES, INVENTORIES, RECEIVABLES, LONG-LIVED ASSETS, LIABILITIES, OWNERSHIP EQUITY, AND INTERNAL CONTROL FOR CORPORATIONS AND OTHER BUSINESS ENTITIES. EMPHASIS WILL ALSO BE PLACED ON THE USE OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS A BASIS FOR BUSINESS DECISIONS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
